intro: Ononis jahandiezii, commonly known as the Persian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, and its hairy, branched stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Ononis jahandiezii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic flora.
